tweets.content: @MarieLintzer: How #opendata project payments from mines and oil fields can help analyze governance issues @davidmihalyi #IODC16pic.twitter.com/6iYhTria52
@Fscrollini: Now Anna Alberts presents a great project opendbudgets.eu #IODC16. It challenges a larger and complex governance system
@GlobalStat_eu: #data need to come alive in the minds of people to be/become relevant! (and used!) FULLY AGREE! @alkags #iodc16 #civilsociety #stats

session.description: Open Data + Performance / Building Open Performance into the Fabric of Government

conference_notes:
• Standardisation of open parliament data is a key element to make these data actually reusable.
  • Suneeta Kaimal (Natural Resource Governance Institute): “Open data in its best shape can really be an essential ingredient to transform the relationship between governments and citizens”.
  • Nenna Wakinama (Web Foundation): “Data (government data) does not belong to the government but the people”.
  • Data can help solving inequality issues as it allows identifying potential issues to be solved.
  • Gathering and collecting of data requires from additional resources to the existing ones in order to provide actual results.
name: Governance
